pr_title: Updated CHANGELOGs and READMEs for the October 2020 Key Vault Beta release.

timeline.message: Updated CHANGELOG files to follow the new guidelines.

timeline.bodyText:
why was this ? 4.2.1 previously  on Master ?
Isn't master on beta ?
timeline.author: g2vinay
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -16,7 +16,7 @@ Maven dependency for the Azure Key Vault Secrets client library. Add it to your
 <dependency>
     <groupId>com.azure</groupId>
     <artifactId>azure-security-keyvault-secrets</artifactId>
-    <version>4.2.1</version>

replies.bodyText: If I recall correctly, the READMEs on master should point to the latest stable version, even if they were released from a different branch.
replies.author: vcolin7

replies.bodyText:
okay, its fine for README to point to stable release.
But the master pom should reflect beta. Else this will create confusion for both users and developers in our team when looking at the code.
replies.author: g2vinay

replies.bodyText: Definitely. The POMs are correctly pointing to the beta versions or Key Vault libraries in master.
replies.author: vcolin7

timeline.author: g2vinay
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,7 +1,18 @@
 # Release History
 
-## 4.0.0-beta.2 (Unreleased)
+## 4.0.0-beta.2 (2020-10-09)
 
+### New Features
+- Added the new public APIs `getBackupOperation` and `getRestoreOperation` for querying the status of long-running operations in `KeyVaultBackupClient` and `KeyVaultBackupAsyncClient`.
+- Added API overloads that allow for passing specific polling intervals for long-running operations.

timeline.author: g2vinay
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,7 +1,18 @@
 # Release History
 
-## 4.2.0-beta.2 (Unreleased)
-
+## 4.2.0-beta.2 (2020-10-09)
+
+### New Features
+- Added `KeyVaultCertificateIdentifier`. Use its `parse` method to parse the different elements of a given certificate identifier, for example: "https://{key-vault-name}.vault.azure.net/certificates/{certificate-name}/{version}".
+- Added API overloads that allow for passing specific polling intervals for long-running operations.

timeline.bodyText: instead of example, better to point to sample.
